columns.name: id
columns.comment: The logical identifier of the entity in the repository, e.g. a UUID. This id is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different id in a different system.

columns.name: primary_diagnosis
columns.comment: The diagnosis instance that qualified a subject for inclusion on a ResearchProject.

columns.name: age_at_diagnosis
columns.comment: The age in days of the individual at the time of diagnosis.

columns.name: morphology
columns.comment: Code that represents the histology of the disease using the third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.

columns.name: stage
columns.comment: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

columns.name: grade
columns.comment: The degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation, the extent to which cancer cells are similar in appearance and function to healthy cells of the same tissue type. The degree of differentiation often relates to the clinical behavior of the particular tumor. Based on the microscopic findings, tumor grade is commonly described by one of four degrees of severity. Histopathologic grade of a tumor may be used to plan treatment and estimate the future course, outcome, and overall prognosis of disease. Certain types of cancers, such as soft tissue sarcoma, primary brain tumors, lymphomas, and breast have special grading systems.

columns.name: method_of_diagnosis
columns.comment: The method used to confirm the subjects malignant diagnosis.

comment: A collection of characteristics that describe an abnormal condition of the body as assessed at a point in time. May be used to capture information about neoplastic and non-neoplastic conditions.

columns.name: system
columns.comment: The system or namespace that defines the identifier.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The value of the identifier, as defined by the system.

comment: A business identifier or accession number for a Diagnosis, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems (i.e. a logical identifier).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The logical identifier of the entity in the repository, e.g. a UUID. This id is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different id in a different system.

columns.name: label
columns.comment: Short name or abbreviation for dataset. Maps to rdfs:label.

columns.name: data_category
columns.comment: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

columns.name: data_type
columns.comment: Specific content type of the data file.

columns.name: file_format
columns.comment: Format of the data files.

columns.name: drs_uri
columns.comment: A string of characters used to identify a resource on the Data Repo Service(DRS).

columns.name: byte_size
columns.comment: Size of the file in bytes. Maps to dcat:byteSize.

columns.name: checksum
columns.comment: A digit representing the sum of the correct digits in a piece of stored or transmitted digital data, against which later comparisons can be made to detect errors in the data.

columns.name: data_modality
columns.comment: Data modality describes the biological nature of the information gathered as the result of an Activity, independent of the technology or methods used to produce the information.

columns.name: imaging_modality
columns.comment: An imaging modality describes the imaging equipment and/or method used to acquire certain structural or functional information about the body. These include but are not limited to computed tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). Taken from the DICOM standard.

columns.name: dbgap_accession_number
columns.comment: The dbgap accession number for the project.

columns.name: imaging_series
columns.comment: The logical identifier of the series or grouping of imaging files in the system of record which the file is a part of.

comment: The core collection of File records.

A reference to the Project(s) of which this File is a member. The associated_project may be embedded using the $ref definition or may be a reference to the id for the Project - or a URI expressed as a string to an existing entity.

columns.name: system
columns.comment: The system or namespace that defines the identifier.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The value of the identifier, as defined by the system.

comment: A business identifier or accession number for a File, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems (i.e. a logical identifier).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The logical identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This id is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different id in a different system. For CDA, this is case_id.

columns.name: member_of_research_project
columns.comment: A reference to the Study(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member.

columns.name: primary_diagnosis_condition
columns.comment: The text term used to describe the type of malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organizations (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This attribute represents the disease that qualified the subject for inclusion on the ResearchProject.

columns.name: primary_diagnosis_site
columns.comment: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organizations (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories. This attribute represents the primary site of disease that qualified the subject for inclusion on the ResearchProject.

comment: A research subject is the entity of interest in a specific research study or project, typically a human being or an animal, but can also be a device, group of humans or animals, or a tissue sample. Human research subjects are usually not traceable to a particular person to protect the subjects privacy. This entity plays the role of the case_id in existing data.

columns.name: system
columns.comment: The system or namespace that defines the identifier.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The value of the identifier, as defined by the system.

comment: A business identifier or accession number for a ResearchSubject, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems (i.e. a logical identifier).

columns.name: project_short_name
columns.comment: Project name abbreviation; the program name appended with a project name abbreviation; eg. TCGA-OV, etc.

columns.name: case_barcode
columns.comment: Original case barcode, eg TCGA-DX-A8BN

columns.name: cda_subject_id
columns.comment: CDA subject ID corresponding to value in case_barcode

columns.name: primary_site
columns.comment: Anatomical site of the cancer under investigation or review

columns.name: hugo_symbol
columns.comment: HUGO symbol for the gene (HUGO symbols are always in all caps). Unknown is used for regions that do not correspond to a gene

columns.name: entrez_gene_id
columns.comment: Entrez gene ID (an integer). 0 is used for regions that do not correspond to a gene region or Ensembl ID

columns.name: center
columns.comment: One or more genome sequencing center reporting the variant

columns.name: ncbi_build
columns.comment: The reference genome used for the alignment (GRCh38)

columns.name: chromosome
columns.comment: Chromosome, possible values: chr1-22, and chrX

columns.name: start_position
columns.comment: Lowest numeric position of the reported variant on the genomic reference sequence. Mutation start coordinate

columns.name: end_position
columns.comment: Highest numeric genomic position of the reported variant on the genomic reference sequence. Mutation end coordinate

columns.name: strand
columns.comment: Either + or - to denote whether read mapped to the sense (+) or anti-sense (-) strand

columns.name: variant_classification
columns.comment: Translational effect of variant allele

columns.name: variant_type
columns.comment: Type of mutation. TNP (tri-nucleotide polymorphism) is analogous to DNP (di-nucleotide polymorphism) but for three consecutive nucleotides. ONP (oligo-nucleotide polymorphism) is analogous to TNP but for consecutive runs of four or more (SNP, DNP, TNP, ONP, INS, DEL, or Consolidated)

columns.name: reference_allele
columns.comment: The plus strand reference allele at this position. Includes the deleted sequence for a deletion or - for an insertion

columns.name: tumor_seq_allele1
columns.comment: Primary data genotype for tumor sequencing (discovery) allele 1. A - symbol for a deletion represents a variant. A - symbol for an insertion represents wild-type allele. Novel inserted sequence for insertion does not include flanking reference bases

columns.name: tumor_seq_allele2
columns.comment: Primary data genotype for tumor sequencing (discovery) allele 2. A - symbol for a deletion represents a variant. A - symbol for an insertion represents wild-type allele. Novel inserted sequence for insertion does not include flanking reference bases

columns.name: dbsnp_rs
columns.comment: The rs-IDs from the dbSNP database, novel if not found in any database used, or null if there is no dbSNP record, but it is found in other databases

columns.name: dbsnp_val_status
columns.comment: The dbSNP validation status is reported as a semicolon-separated list of statuses. The union of all rs-IDs is taken when there are multiple

columns.name: tumor_aliquot_barcode
columns.comment: Aliquot barcode for the tumor sample

columns.name: matched_norm_aliquot_barcode
columns.comment: Aliquot barcode for the matched normal sample

columns.name: match_norm_seq_allele1
columns.comment: Primary data genotype. Matched normal sequencing allele 1. A - symbol for a deletion represents a variant. A - symbol for an insertion represents wild-type allele. Novel inserted sequence for insertion does not include flanking reference bases (cleared in somatic MAF)

columns.name: match_norm_seq_allele2
columns.comment: Matched normal sequencing allele 2

columns.name: tumor_validation_allele1
columns.comment: Secondary data from orthogonal technology. Tumor genotyping (validation) for allele 1. A - symbol for a deletion represents a variant. A - symbol for an insertion represents wild-type allele. Novel inserted sequence for insertion does not include flanking reference bases

columns.name: tumor_validation_allele2
columns.comment: Secondary data from orthogonal technology. Tumor genotyping (validation) for allele 2

columns.name: match_norm_validation_allele1
columns.comment: Secondary data from orthogonal technology. Matched normal genotyping (validation) for allele 1. A - symbol for a deletion represents a variant. A - symbol for an insertion represents wild-type allele. Novel inserted sequence for insertion does not include flanking reference bases (cleared in somatic MAF)

columns.name: match_norm_validation_allele2
columns.comment: Secondary data from orthogonal technology. Matched normal genotyping (validation) for allele 2 (cleared in somatic MAF)

columns.name: verification_status
columns.comment: Second pass results from independent attempt using same methods as primary data source. Generally reserved for 3730 Sanger Sequencing

columns.name: validation_status
columns.comment: Second pass results from orthogonal technology

columns.name: mutation_status
columns.comment: An assessment of the mutation as somatic, germline, LOH, post transcriptional modification, unknown, or none. The values allowed in this field are constrained by the value in the Validation_Status field

columns.name: sequencing_phase
columns.comment: TCGA sequencing phase (if applicable). Phase should change under any circumstance that the targets under consideration change

columns.name: sequence_source
columns.comment: Molecular assay type used to produce the analytes used for sequencing. Allowed values are a subset of the SRA 1.5 library_strategy field values. This subset matches those used at CGHub

columns.name: validation_method
columns.comment: The assay platforms used for the validation call

columns.name: score
columns.comment: Not in use

columns.name: bam_file
columns.comment: Not in use

columns.name: sequencer
columns.comment: Instrument used to produce primary sequence data

columns.name: tumor_aliquot_uuid
columns.comment: Unique GDC identifier for tumor aliquot (10189 unique)

columns.name: matched_norm_aliquot_uuid
columns.comment: Unique GDC identifier for normal aliquot (10189 unique)

columns.name: hgvsc
columns.comment: The coding sequence of the variant in HGVS recommended format

columns.name: hgvsp
columns.comment: The protein sequence of the variant in HGVS recommended format. p.= signifies no change in the protein

columns.name: hgvsp_short
columns.comment: Same as the HGVSp column, but using 1-letter amino-acid codes

columns.name: transcript_id
columns.comment: Ensembl ID of the transcript affected by the variant

columns.name: exon_number
columns.comment: The exon number (out of total number)

columns.name: t_depth
columns.comment: Read depth across this locus in tumor BAM

columns.name: t_ref_count
columns.comment: Read depth supporting the reference allele in tumor BAM

columns.name: t_alt_count
columns.comment: Read depth supporting the variant allele in tumor BAM

columns.name: n_depth
columns.comment: Read depth across this locus in normal BAM

columns.name: n_ref_count
columns.comment: Read depth supporting the reference allele in normal BAM (cleared in somatic MAF)

columns.name: n_alt_count
columns.comment: Read depth supporting the variant allele in normal BAM (cleared in somatic MAF)

columns.name: all_effects
columns.comment: A semicolon delimited list of all possible variant effects, sorted by priority ([Symbol,Consequence,HGVSp_Short,Transcript_ID,RefSeq,HGVSc,Impact,Canonical,Sift,PolyPhen,Strand])

columns.name: allele
columns.comment: The variant allele used to calculate the consequence

columns.name: gene
columns.comment: The gene symbol. In this table, gene symbol is gene name e.g. ACADVL

columns.name: feature
columns.comment: Stable Ensembl ID of feature (transcript, regulatory, motif)

columns.name: feature_type
columns.comment: Type of feature. Currently one of Transcript, RegulatoryFeature, MotifFeature (or blank)

columns.name: one_consequence
columns.comment: The single consequence of the canonical transcript in sequence ontology terms, eg missense_variant

columns.name: consequence
columns.comment: Consequence type of this variant; sequence ontology terms

columns.name: cdna_position
columns.comment: Relative position of base pair in the cDNA sequence as a fraction. A - symbol is displayed as the numerator if the variant does not appear in cDNA

columns.name: cds_position
columns.comment: Relative position of base pair in coding sequence. A - symbol is displayed as the numerator if the variant does not appear in coding sequence

columns.name: protein_position
columns.comment: Relative position of affected amino acid in protein. A - symbol is displayed as the numerator if the variant does not appear in coding sequence

columns.name: amino_acids
columns.comment: Amino acid substitution caused by the mutation. Only given if the variation affects the protein-coding sequence

columns.name: codons
columns.comment: The alternative codons with the variant base in upper case

columns.name: existing_variation
columns.comment: Known identifier of existing variation

columns.name: distance
columns.comment: Shortest distance from the variant to transcript

columns.name: transcript_strand
columns.comment: The DNA strand (1 or -1) on which the transcript/feature lies

columns.name: symbol
columns.comment: Eg TP53, LRP1B, etc (same as Hugo_Symbol field except blank instead of Unknown

columns.name: symbol_source
columns.comment: The source of the gene symbol, usually HGNC, rarely blank, other sources include Uniprot_gn, EntrezGene, etc

columns.name: hgnc_id
columns.comment: Gene identifier from the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee if applicable

columns.name: biotype
columns.comment: Biotype of transcript

columns.name: canonical
columns.comment: A flag (YES) indicating that the VEP-based canonical transcript, the longest translation, was used for this gene. If not, the value is null

columns.name: ccds
columns.comment: The CCDS identifier for this transcript, where applicable

columns.name: ensp
columns.comment: The Ensembl protein identifier of the affected transcript

columns.name: swissprot
columns.comment: UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot accession

columns.name: trembl
columns.comment: UniProtKB/TrEMBL identifier of protein product

columns.name: uniparc
columns.comment: UniParc identifier of protein product

columns.name: uniprot_isoform
columns.comment: Direct mappings to UniProtKB isoforms

columns.name: refseq
columns.comment: RefSeq identifier for this transcript

columns.name: mane
columns.comment: MANE (Matched Annotation by NCBI and EMBL-EBI) Transcript

columns.name: appris
columns.comment: Annotates alternatively spliced transcripts as primary or alternate based on a range of computational methods

columns.name: flags
columns.comment: Transcript quality flags

columns.name: sift
columns.comment: The SIFT prediction and/or score, with both given as prediction (score)

columns.name: polyphen
columns.comment: The PolyPhen prediction and/or score

columns.name: exon
columns.comment: The exon number (out of total number)

columns.name: intron
columns.comment: The intron number (out of total number)

columns.name: domains
columns.comment: The source and identifier of any overlapping protein domains

columns.name: thousg_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in 1000 Genomes

columns.name: thousg_afr_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in 1000 Genomes combined African population

columns.name: thousg_amr_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in 1000 Genomes combined American population

columns.name: thousg_eas_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in 1000 Genomes combined East Asian population

columns.name: thousg_eur_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in 1000 Genomes combined European population

columns.name: thousg_sas_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in 1000 Genomes combined South Asian population

columns.name: esp_aa_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in NHLBI-ESP African American population

columns.name: esp_ea_af
columns.comment: Non-reference allele and frequency of existing variant in NHLBI-ESP European American population

columns.name: gnomad_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes combined population

columns.name: gnomad_afr_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes African/American population

columns.name: gnomad_amr_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes American population

columns.name: gnomad_asj_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes Ashkenazi Jewish population

columns.name: gnomad_eas_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes East Asian population

columns.name: gnomad_fin_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes Finnish population

columns.name: gnomad_nfe_af
columns.comment: tFrequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes Non-Finnish European population

columns.name: gnomad_oth_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes other combined population

columns.name: gnomad_sas_af
columns.comment: Frequency of existing variant in gnomAD exomes South Asian population

columns.name: max_af
columns.comment: Maximum observed allele frequency in 1000 Genomes, ESP and ExAC/gnomAD

columns.name: max_af_pops
columns.comment: Populations in which maximum allele frequency was observed

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes combined non-cancer population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_afr_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer African/American population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_ami_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer Amish population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_amr_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer Latino population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_asj_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer Ashkenazi Jewish population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_eas_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer East Asian population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_fin_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer Finnish population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_mid_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer Middle Eastern population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_nfe_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer Non-Finnish European population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_oth_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer Other population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_sas_af
columns.comment: Frequency of exisiting variant in gnomAD genomes non-cancer South Asian population

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_max_af_adj
columns.comment: Maximum observed allele frequency in non-cancer gnomAD genomes populations after removing subpopulations with less than 2 allele counts

columns.name: gnomad_non_cancer_max_af_pops_adj
columns.comment: Non-cancer gnomAD genomes populations in which the maximum allele frequency was observed after removing those with less than 2 allele counts

columns.name: clin_sig
columns.comment: Clinical significance of variant from dbSNP

columns.name: somatic
columns.comment: Somatic status of each ID reported under Existing_variation (0, 1, or null)

columns.name: pubmed
columns.comment: Pubmed ID(s) of publications that cite existing variant

columns.name: transcription_factors
columns.comment: List of transcription factors which bind to the transcription factor binding profile

columns.name: motif_name
columns.comment: The source and identifier of a transcription factor binding profile aligned at this position

columns.name: motif_pos
columns.comment: The relative position of the variation in the aligned TFBP

columns.name: high_inf_pos
columns.comment: A flag indicating if the variant falls in a high information position of a transcription factor binding profile (TFBP) (Y, N, or null)

columns.name: motif_score_change
columns.comment: The difference in motif score of the reference and variant sequences for the TFBP

columns.name: mirna
columns.comment: SO terms of overlapped miRNA secondary structure feature(s)

columns.name: impact
columns.comment: The impact modifier for the consequence type

columns.name: pick
columns.comment: Indicates if this block of consequence data was picked by VEPs pick feature (1 or null)

columns.name: variant_class
columns.comment: Sequence Ontology variant class

columns.name: tsl
columns.comment: Transcript support level, which is based on independent RNA analyses

columns.name: hgvs_offset
columns.comment: Indicates by how many bases the HGVS notations for this variant have been shifted

columns.name: pheno
columns.comment: Indicates if existing variant is associated with a phenotype, disease or trait (0, 1, or null)

columns.name: gene_pheno
columns.comment: Indicates if gene that the variant maps to is associated with a phenotype, disease or trait (0, 1, or null)

columns.name: context
columns.comment: The reference allele per VCF specs, and its five flanking base pairs

columns.name: tumor_submitter_uuid
columns.comment: Unique GDC identifier for the tumor file submitter

columns.name: normal_submitter_uuid
columns.comment: Unique GDC identifier for the normal file submitter

columns.name: case_id
columns.comment: Unique GDC identifier for the underlying case

columns.name: gdc_filter
columns.comment: GDC filters applied universally across all MAFs

columns.name: cosmic
columns.comment: Overlapping COSMIC variants

columns.name: hotspot
columns.comment: A flag indicating if the variant is a known hotspot (Y, N, or null)

columns.name: rna_support
columns.comment: Indicates if the variant is found and alleles (Match), simply (Overlap), or is not supported (No) by tumor RNA-Seq. If it has not been checked against RNA-Seq data, the value will be Unknown.

columns.name: rna_depth
columns.comment: Read depth at this locus if the variant is supported by tumor RNA-seq data.

columns.name: rna_ref_count
columns.comment: Read depth supporting the reference allele at this locus if the variant is supported by tumor RNA-seq data.

columns.name: rna_alt_count
columns.comment: Read depth supporting the variant allele at this locus if the variant is supported by tumor RNA-seq data.

columns.name: callers
columns.comment: |-delimited list of mutation caller(s) that agreed on this particular call, always in alphabetical order: muse, mutect, somaticsniper, varscan

columns.name: file_gdc_id
columns.comment: |-delimited list of unique GDC identifiers for underlying MAF file

columns.name: muse
columns.comment: Muse caller identified the variant at this position

columns.name: mutect2
columns.comment: Mutect2 caller identified the variant at this position

columns.name: pindel
columns.comment: pindel caller identified the variant at this position

columns.name: varscan2
columns.comment: Varscan2 caller identified the variant at this position

columns.name: sample_barcode_tumor
columns.comment: TCGA sample barcode for the tumor, eg TCGA-12-1089-01A. One sample may have multiple sets of CN segmentations corresponding to multiple aliquots; use GROUP BY appropriately in queries

columns.name: sample_barcode_normal
columns.comment: TCGA sample barcode for the normal control, eg TCGA-12-1089-01A. One sample may have multiple sets of CN segmentations corresponding to multiple aliquots; use GROUP BY appropriately in queries

columns.name: aliquot_barcode_tumor
columns.comment: TCGA aliquot barcode for the tumor, eg TCGA-12-1089-01A-01D-0517-01

columns.name: aliquot_barcode_normal
columns.comment: TCGA aliquot barcode for the normal control, eg TCGA-12-1089-01A-01D-0517-01]

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The logical identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This id is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different id in a different system.

columns.name: associated_project
columns.comment: The Project associated with the specimen.

columns.name: days_to_collection
columns.comment: The number of days from the index date to either the date a sample was collected for a specific study or project, or the date a subject underwent a procedure (e.g. surgical resection) yielding a sample that was eventually used for research.

columns.name: primary_disease_type
columns.comment: The text term used to describe the type of malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organizations (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This attribute represents the disease that qualified the subject for inclusion on the ResearchProject.

columns.name: anatomical_site
columns.comment: Per GDC Dictionary, the text term that represents the name of the primary disease site of the submitted tumor sample; recommend dropping tumor; biospecimen_anatomic_site.

columns.name: source_material_type
columns.comment: The general kind of material from which the specimen was derived, indicating the physical nature of the source material.

columns.name: specimen_type
columns.comment: The high-level type of the specimen, based on its how it has been derived from the original extracted sample.

columns.name: derived_from_specimen
columns.comment: A source/parent specimen from which this one was directly derived.

columns.name: derived_from_subject
columns.comment: The Patient/ResearchSubject, or Biologically Derived Materal (e.g. a cell line, tissue culture, organoid) from which the specimen was directly or indirectly derived.

comment: Any material taken as a sample from a biological entity (living or dead), or from a physical object or the environment. Specimens are usually collected as an example of their kind, often for use in some investigation.

columns.name: system
columns.comment: The system or namespace that defines the identifier.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The value of the identifier, as defined by the system.

comment: A business identifier or accession number for a Specimen, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems (i.e. a logical identifier).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The logical identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This id is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different id in a different system.

columns.name: species
columns.comment: The taxonomic group (e.g. species) of the patient. For MVP, since taxonomy vocabulary is consistent between GDC and PDC, using text. Ultimately, this will be a term returned by the vocabulary service.

columns.name: sex
columns.comment: The biologic character or quality that distinguishes male and female from one another as expressed by analysis of the persons gonadal, morphologic (internal and external), chromosomal, and hormonal characteristics.

columns.name: race
columns.comment: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

columns.name: ethnicity
columns.comment: An individuals self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

columns.name: days_to_birth
columns.comment: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a persons date of birth represented as a calculated negative number of days.

columns.name: vital_status
columns.comment: Coded value indicating the state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown.

columns.name: days_to_death
columns.comment: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a persons date of death represented as a calculated number of days.

columns.name: cause_of_death
columns.comment: Coded value indicating the circumstance or condition that results in the death of the subject.

comment: The core collection of Subject records.

columns.name: system
columns.comment: The system or namespace that defines the identifier.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The value of the identifier, as defined by the system.

comment: A business identifier or accession number for a Subject, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems (i.e. a logical identifier).

columns.name: id
columns.comment: The logical identifier of the entity in the repository, e.g. a UUID. This id is unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different id in a different system.

columns.name: treatment_type
columns.comment: The treatment type including medication/therapeutics or other procedures.

columns.name: treatment_outcome
columns.comment: The final outcome of the treatment.

columns.name: days_to_treatment_start
columns.comment: The timepoint at which the treatment started.

columns.name: days_to_treatment_end
columns.comment: The timepoint at which the treatment ended.

columns.name: therapeutic_agent
columns.comment: One or more therapeutic agents as part of this treatment.

columns.name: treatment_anatomic_site
columns.comment: The anatomical site that the treatment targets.

columns.name: treatment_effect
columns.comment: The effect of a treatment on the diagnosis or tumor.

columns.name: treatment_end_reason
columns.comment: The reason the treatment ended.

columns.name: number_of_cycles
columns.comment: The number of treatment cycles the subject received.

comment: Represent medication administration or other treatment types.

columns.name: system
columns.comment: The system or namespace that defines the identifier.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The value of the identifier, as defined by the system.

comment: A business identifier or accession number for a Treatment, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems (i.e. a logical identifier).
